title: [Bug]: 2.1.0 is not displaying the chat and contacts list correctly
body: ### Can you reproduce this bug in the website/PWA? Yes, however solved by using disable GPU Rasterization from the Chrome chrome://flags options. ### Describe the bug After updating to 2.1.0, the message window and contacts list is displaying incorrectly. When displaying, there are extra layers displaying over the text and images. This problem has also recently happened on the same machine with Chrome, this was solved by disabling GPU Rasterization from chrome://flags. This is happening on an older machine with an integrated Intel CPU (Intel Core 2 Duo). If possible, is there a work around by using the Teams for Linux config.json file? ### What package are you using? deb ### Version 2.1.0 ### Reproduction steps ```markdown 1. From MATE Ubuntu Linux, update to the latest version of Teams for Linux. 2. Restart and login to Teams for Linux if required. 3. Open an existing chat. The extra layers will be covering the text and images. 4. View the contacts list, the same issue, extra layers will be covering some or all names. ``` ### Expected Behavior ```markdown 1. It is expected that the contacts, text and images will not be covered by extra layers. ``` ### Debug ```markdown teams-for-linux --webDebug --logConfig='{}' No config file found, using default values Initialising logger with config: "{}" 12:48:07.713 › File logging at /home/USER/.config/teams-for-linux/logs/main.log with level silly 12:48:07.718 › Console logging enabled with level silly 12:48:07.719 › Logger initialised 12:48:07.720 › configPath: /home/USER/.config/teams-for-linux 12:48:07.721 › configFile: {} 12:48:07.907 › (node:97927) [DEP0180] DeprecationWarning: fs.Stats constructor is deprecated.
